thread.title: Doom 3 Hell On Earth Baron of Hell Model Public Release?

post.date: Posted: Sat Apr 30, 2005 5:44 pm Post subject:
post.author: Makaveli
post.body: I don't know what you guys mean about not asking permission. I emailed fly and he said yes, I tryed to email neowar's old email address because I couldn't find his new one, and I don't know jack's email. I never planned on getting it out without their permission.

post.date: Posted: Sat Apr 30, 2005 7:58 pm Post subject:
post.author: xPreatorianx
post.body:
Well all I got to say on the whole situation is get permission from the mod leaders or the model maker if he says release it to the public release that is all dont sit here and make a big deal out of it it is a good model if the guy does not want u to release it dont. But if u got permission from a guy higher up from him then release if not then just go about your business im sure other guys in this community can make a model just as good or better and release it in a map or just release it.
_________________
Picked up a double barrel shotgun

post.date: Posted: Fri Sep 15, 2006 8:18 pm Post subject:
post.author: Carnifexx
post.body: Did anyone by any chance ever happen to get this model? And if so then where?

post.date: Posted: Fri Apr 29, 2005 2:14 am Post subject: Doom 3 Hell On Earth Baron of Hell Model Public Release?
post.author: Makaveli
post.body:
I've been thinking about releasing HoE's Baron model since it's just been sitting around collecting dust.

Image

Is anyone interested in downloading this puppy?

The one problem is that it hasn't been animated, our team didn't get around to completing that when the mod was unplugged.

post.date: Posted: Fri Apr 29, 2005 2:57 am Post subject:
post.author: xwarpedx
post.body:
very much so, even if it isnt animated its still a beautiful piece of work im sure someone out there will put it to good use
_________________
I won't give up until their blood soaks my fingers...

post.date: Posted: Fri Apr 29, 2005 2:59 am Post subject:
post.author: Zephbane
post.body:
Funny you mention it. I have just started messing with animation.. I'll use it as my guinie-pig... where can I d/l it?

P.S. As a side note, I still have the Command Frigate Delphi map I was working on. It's nearly complete, as I plan on releasing it when I'm done.

post.date: Posted: Fri Apr 29, 2005 3:44 am Post subject:
post.author: revility
post.body: I'd contact neowar and fly soup about this before doing so, it is thier work. Jack as well because it is his design mainly.

post.body:
holy shit that looks good. can someone animate it? along with side stepping animations? then let me use it in my marines-vs-demons mod? kthx

post.date: Posted: Fri Apr 29, 2005 8:05 am Post subject:
post.author: Kristus
post.body:
I remember that Neowar didn't have any plans to release the model to be used by just anyone.

EDIT: Argonaut asked me to forward to this thread that Neowar hasn't alowed for his model to be released at all. And he doesn't plan to release it for common people use either. Makaveli; you better take this up with Neowar himself before proceeding with your intended actions or you could find yourself in some serious trouble.
_________________

http://www.doomworld.com/phobos

argo notified me about this, so please mak dont release it.

somebody has already made a high poly model of a baron that they used for an animation. it looks extremely close to the doom1 version.

post.date: Posted: Sat Apr 30, 2005 6:26 am Post subject:
post.author: Zephbane
post.body:
neowar3020 wrote:
the things the ex-team had should NOT be released.


So your saying the Delphi I was mapping, for a mod that no longer exists, shouldn't be released to the public? Or is that just another way of asking for people to not release work of your's with out permission? (which is fine, btw).

I very much plan on releasing the Delphi map that was for Hell on Earth mod. When ever it's done

post.date: Posted: Sat Apr 30, 2005 7:49 am Post subject:
post.author: rich_is_bored
post.body:
I don't understand the rational behind mod teams witholding assets when their mod fails.

Especially since we're talking about content that is game ready. It just seems like a waste of time considering that a lot of effort was put into making assets work with Doom 3 specifically, only for these assets never to see the light of day.

I can understand people wanting credit for their work and how often times when people do give away assets they don't recieve any credit.

But seriously, we're all making things here and nobody is getting paid for it.

If people are talented enough to produce assets that are top notch like this model here then certainly they won't have any trouble jumping on board another mod team and getting their work out their and noticed.

That's what you all want credit for anyways right?
_________________
Staff
Learn something today? Why not write an article about it on modwiki.net?

post.date: Posted: Sat Apr 30, 2005 8:26 am Post subject:
post.author: ViPr
post.body: the reason is that the author is probably using it for another engine or another mod.

the reason is that the author is probably using it for another engine or another mod.

Especially since we're talking about content that is game ready. It just seems like a waste of time considering that a lot of effort was put into making assets work with Doom 3 specifically, only for these assets never to see the light of day.

I can understand people wanting credit for their work and how often times when people do give away assets they don't recieve any credit.

But seriously, we're all making things here and nobody is getting paid for it.

If people are talented enough to produce assets that are top notch like this model here then certainly they won't have any trouble jumping on board another mod team and getting their work out their and noticed.

That's what you all want credit for anyways right?

I agree 100%

post.date: Posted: Sat Apr 30, 2005 4:32 pm Post subject:
post.author: Kristus
post.body:
As I see it it's up to neowar weather he want to release it or not. Makaveli who only were on the HoE team as a forum moderator (IIRC), shouldn't (and doesn't) have any right to release Neowars models. Whatever reason Neowar may have for not wanting to release his model, is entirely up to him weather they are valid or not.

post.date: Posted: Sat Apr 30, 2005 5:17 pm Post subject:
post.author: Meh Whatever
post.body:
That doesn't change that it's difficult to follow the reasoning behind not releasing assets, assuming they're just lying around.

Is there a miscontent with the product, a fear that it wont receive deserving credit, plans for future use or what?

Of course, no matter what, it's the author's decision, so I'll shut up now.
